title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB:
When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. The steps to reproduce the issue are as follows:

1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. The newly created data source should have no database/table/column information.

Actual Result:
No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. To replicate the issue, close the data set editor and reopen it.
EB:
Expected Result:
When changing the data source, the new data source should list out its children nodes.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Navigate to the data set editor page in the query tab.
3. Change the data source for the data set.
4. Verify that the children nodes for the new data source are listed.
